A wonderful place to stay in a safe and friendly area!!
Normally, I avoid booking places with no reviews. I decided to give Amber's place a shot. I am sure glad I did.
The home is on a nice and quiet road with excellent neighbors. It's safe (close to an elementary school and library) and feels like home. The streets are wide with sidewalks everywhere to walk safely on. The neighborhood is perfect for morning and afternoon walks.
Getting to the house is easily accessible from the main road and only 10 minutes or less from the highway. The shops that you need are all withing 10 minutes (Walmart, grocery store, quaint little restaurants, gift shops, etc.)
As we entered the house, the first thing we noticed was how room it was because of just the right sized furniture that was very, very comfortable (I fell asleep one night on the bean bag and felt great in the morning!). The living room had every thing you need.
The kitchen was thoughtfully setup. Coffee available in three fashions: Standard drip, Keurig cups, AND a French Press (Yipee!!!). Fresh coffee grounds were stocked along with everything I needed for a fresh cup of coffee in the morning.
That coffee was great with the breakfast that Amber provided (bagels, cream cheese, etc.). Nice touch, Amber! This made our first morning comfortable and we did not have to rush out to get something to eat.
When we decided to bring food to the house, we had every thing we needed to eat and also prepare our meals. The air fryer was the perfect appliance to warm up our food. Microwaves just ruin food. Warming in an air fryer is quick and makes the food taste so much better.
When it was time to rest, the beds were comfortable, inviting, and warm. Since the nights were cold outside, I looked forward to curling up inside the blankets of the bed to have a great night rest.
As for Amber as our host, she was amazing! She made sure we had everything we needed prior to our arrival. She also communicated quickly, clearly, and completely. I've stayed at a lot of AirBnBs (look at my profile). I can say that Amber is one of the best hosts I've communicated with.
We will certainly stay here again if we return to Mountain Home.
Thanks, Amber.

We were gifted with a yummy huckleberry bar and there was coffee and hot cocoa available. The tv wasn't internet connected. However, if you bring a laptop or something else with hdmi connection several hdmi cables are there ready to connect and you'll have Netflix, Amazon Prime TV, etc. via your component and provided wifi. Then travel the hour to the petroglyphs - lots of fun looking amongst the rocks and watching the golden eagles nest as they try to keep those babies fed. The information center is pretty cool too. Then head for the sand dunesâ€¦ who'd of thunk there would be giant sand dunes in the middle sagebrush country! There's also an observatory there, but sadly we weren't there over the weekend and it was closed. For a short trip from the house check out the Trueblood wildlife area where there were all kinds of birds to see as well as rascally jack rabbits. Make sure to bring most of the groceries you might need. Grand View has the basics, don't expect more than that. There's a cafe we stopped at which Melissa listed in her info book and the food was good. We thoroughly enjoyed our visit. I for one would love to return someday.
